paragraphs: For the fourth year in a row, a unique historical carousel, over 200 years old, has been brought to Prague from Florence. It was installed on Petřín Hill next to the famous observation tower (see on the map).
The attraction started operating on Saturday, May 25, and will be in the city until September 29, 2024.
The carousel owned by a private owner (an Italian family) was rented by the city tourism development agency Prague City Tourism.
It is designed to accommodate both children and adults. Therefore, anyone who wishes to can take a ride.
The first written mention of a carousel dates back to 1820, but it was likely created much earlier - most likely in the late 17th century. Only three similar carousels have survived to this day.
Cost: one trip - 100 crowns, four trips - 300 crowns, ten trips - 600 crowns.
